nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: At home, your parents ask about school — sometimes their questions sound like pressure to be perfect.

nodes.speaker: Player
nodes.text: They want good grades, but I also want to enjoy things. How do I tell them?

choices.text: Explain your worries and ask for space.
Promise to try harder to calm them down.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Your parents are quiet at first, then open a conversation. It’s not perfect, but you’re heard.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: They relax, but you feel the weight of a promise you didn’t choose fully yourself.

nodes.speaker: Player
nodes.text: Family wants the best, but my path matters too. I can try to balance both.
